Starstories.title: Bloodsport Telemetry System
Starstories.situation: I was tasked with developing the telemetry system for Bloodsport under the uncertainty of a 6-week deadline due to an unknown TV deal and filming schedule.
Starstories.task: My goal was to build a real-time telemetry system that could monitor the robot’s health for engineers while creating a visually engaging, cinematic display for TV audiences.
action: Dived deep into RF protocols, particularly LoRa, to ensure reliable data transmission in the RF-hostile competition environment.
Self-taught microcontroller design, using KiCAD to create custom boards and manage manufacturing overseas.
Researched telemetry and data visualization best practices, developing a Unity3D-based interface that balanced functionality for engineers with visual appeal for TV audiences.
Managed the entire process under the pressure of unknown deadlines, constantly iterating and learning new aspects of embedded systems, RF transmission, and sensor integration.
Starstories.result: Successfully delivered the fully functional telemetry system on time, which was featured prominently on TV.

Starstories.title: DJ Deck Feature Ownership
Starstories.situation: Took ownership of DJ Deck feature at Wave. Management wanted simplicity; I aimed for depth to satisfy hobbyist DJs.
Starstories.task: Negotiate a solution that balanced management’s desire for accessibility with my vision of a more advanced tool.
action: Pushed for advanced features like beat matching and EQ.
Narrowed down the key features that are the most important for professional DJs.
Innovated with our CCO to design more intuitive and approachable interfaces for 'advanced' functionality.
Negotiated compromises with production and management.
Starstories.result: Delivered a feature that was both approachable and satisfying for serious DJs.
categories: Have a Backbone & Disagree and Commit

Starstories.title: VVR2 Rhythm Game
Starstories.situation: Owned the rhythm game feature for Virtual Virtual Reality 2. My experience as a rhythm game player shaped the design.
Starstories.task: Create an engaging rhythm game feature that would appeal to both casual and experienced players.
action: Designed a generic and extensible rhythm game engine to accommodate various gameplay styles.
Chose Beat Saber clone mechanics to fit the game’s satirical theme.
Conducted the majority of playtesting, refining the game’s playability and feel.
Integrated motion controllers across multiple VR platforms for compatibility.
Starstories.result: The feature was praised for its polish and depth, appealing to both new and experienced players.

Starstories.title: Bloodsport – Cinematic Telemetry UI
Starstories.situation: The Bloodsport telemetry system was designed to give engineers real-time data, but I aimed to create something visually striking.
Starstories.task: Design a telemetry UI that provides critical information while looking visually spectacular for viewers.
action: Drew inspiration from sci-fi interfaces in movies like Iron Man.
Designed a dynamic interface featuring animations and real-time data displays.
Iterated on the UI to ensure it maintained necessary functionality.
Starstories.result: The telemetry UI delivered a high-quality, sci-fi-inspired display that enhances entertainment value.

Starstories.title: Subtitle Tools
Starstories.situation: Tasked with implementing subtitles for multiple language versions of the game.
Starstories.task: Ensure subtitles were completed on time, error-free, and adaptable for future projects.
action: Attempted a manual process to verify and fix subtitles but recognized it was too tedious.
Created automated tools to streamline subtitle generation.
Worked with the team to integrate and document the tools for long-term efficiency.
Starstories.result: Delivered subtitles on time with far fewer errors.

Starstories.title: The Music Update in VVR2
Starstories.situation: I was the only engineer working on The Music Update for VVR2, alongside one artist and the QA lead.
Starstories.task: Extend the rhythm game feature by adding 4 new levels and fixing long-standing bugs.
action: Added 4 new rhythm game levels and implemented scripts for the artist.
Playtested and debugged extensively.
Starstories.result: Released the update on time, leading to a boost in new users.

Starstories.title: Stranger Things VR Chapter Ownership
Starstories.situation: Each developer was entrusted with entire chapters of Stranger Things VR to fully own.
Starstories.task: I was responsible for handling development, production schedules, and quality testing.
action: Managed all aspects of my chapter, from implementation to testing.
Took initiative to handle production details.
Starstories.result: Delivered my chapter on time without major issues.

Starstories.title: Roblox Exploration
Starstories.situation: Wave struck an exploratory partnership with Roblox to port some content.
Starstories.task: Help the team learn Lua and the Roblox platform.
action: Spent significant time learning Roblox development.
Worked with the team to identify technical limitations within Roblox.
Starstories.result: Shipped one of the most sophisticated concert performance experiences in Roblox.

Starstories.title: Wave – Social Safety Features
Starstories.situation: Recognized that user safety in immersive social VR experiences was critical.
Starstories.task: Develop safety systems that exceeded typical expectations.
action: Conducted in-depth research into the highest standards for social safety.
Implemented comprehensive safety features.
Starstories.result: Provided a safe environment, setting a new benchmark for social safety in VR.

Starstories.title: Reusable Rhythm Game Engine
Starstories.situation: I saw an opportunity to create a reusable engine for rhythm games.
Starstories.task: Build a robust, flexible rhythm game system for future projects.
action: Designed a modular rhythm game engine in Unity.
Structured the system to be adaptable across various game designs.
Starstories.result: The engine stands as a model for scalable game design.

Starstories.title: Wave’s Pivot from VR to 2D Video
Starstories.situation: Wave made a strategic decision to pivot from VR experiences to 2D video content.
Starstories.task: Support the pivot while maintaining creativity.
action: Committed to making the pivot successful by exploring new ways to engage users.
Starstories.result: Contributed to the 2D video pivot's success by maintaining user engagement.

Starstories.title: Bloodsport – Safety Compliance
Starstories.situation: Noticed safety compliance was often overlooked.
Starstories.task: Design safety covers that adhere to the highest standards.
action: Conducted thorough research on safety compliance standards.
Designed and manufactured robust safety covers.
Starstories.result: Ensured safety covers exceeded typical safety standards.

Starstories.title: Robot Combat Semi-autonomous Proposals
Starstories.situation: Wanted to use semi-autonomous control in my first entry into robot combat.
Starstories.task: Prove my advanced design approach could work in combat robotics.
action: Pushed forward with my design, incorporating sensor feedback and custom electronics.
Starstories.result: Successfully demonstrated the viability of semi-autonomous controls in a competitive environment.
